original: rigs chen gtsug tor cher gzigs nas //
analyzed: rigs chen gtsug tor cher gzigs nas //
translated: Having seen the great uṣṇīṣa of the great family,

original: zhes pa dang / 'khor gyi nang nas shes rab kyi snying stobs dang ldan par rig pa'i ye shes kyi don rtogs nus pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa dang / 'khor gyi nang nas shes rab kyi snying stobs dang ldan par rig pa'i ye shes kyi don rtogs nus pa'o //
translated: one is able to realize the meaning of the pristine consciousness of vidyā that possesses the courage of wisdom from within the retinue.

original: 'khor gyi nang nas dbu'i gtsug tor ltar gong du 'gyur pa'i dgongs pa nub pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang nas dbu'i gtsug tor ltar gong du 'gyur pa'i dgongs pa nub pa med pa'o //
translated: From within the retinue, the transcendent state of the one who is like the uṣṇīṣa on the head, which is inexhaustible, is explained.

original: de'i don du nges pa'i don du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don du nges pa'i don du gsungs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of that is explained in the definitive meaning.

original: ji ltar gsungs na /
analyzed: ji ltar gsungs na /
translated: How is it explained?

original: tshig gi bdag por gyur pa'i ston pas tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gi bdag por gyur pa'i ston pas tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: The teacher, the lord of words, spoke in verse.

original: de yan chad du le'u dang po'i dgos pa bstan pa'o /
analyzed: de yan chad du le'u dang po'i dgos pa bstan pa'o /
translated: Up to this point, the purpose of the first chapter has been explained.

original: // / da ni le'u gnyis pa mi gnas pa'i ye shes chen po rdo rje 'chang gi don bstan te /
analyzed: // / da ni le'u gnyis pa mi gnas pa'i ye shes chen po rdo rje 'chang gi don bstan te /
translated: Now, the second chapter will be explained, the meaning of Vajradhara, the great, nonabiding pristine consciousness.

original: gsang zhes pa /
analyzed: gsang zhes pa /
translated: Secret means

original: rig pa dngos med kyi ye shes kun gyi thun mong ma yin pa'o //🔽sngags zhes pa de las lhag pa med de /
analyzed: rig pa dngos med kyi ye shes kun gyi thun mong ma yin pa'o // sngags zhes pa de las lhag pa med de /
translated: that the pristine consciousness of nonentity awareness is not common to all.🔽Mantra means

original: don mchog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: don mchog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: that there is nothing higher than that; it is the supreme meaning.

original: rgyal po zhes pa /
analyzed: rgyal po zhes pa /
translated: King means

original: rtogs ma rtogs kyi bye brag gam yon tan gyi snang ba @42a * //
analyzed: rtogs ma rtogs kyi bye brag gam yon tan gyi snang ba @42a * //
translated: that the appearances of the distinctions of realization and nonrealization or the qualities

original: 'khor 'das su shar la /
analyzed: 'khor 'das su shar la /
translated: arise as samsara and nirvana.

original: de 'dus kyang de nyid du 'dus shing grol bas na thams cad kyi bdag po lta bu'o //
analyzed: de 'dus kyang de nyid du 'dus shing grol bas na thams cad kyi bdag po lta bu'o //
translated: Since that is also included in that, it is like the lord of all.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: drug ldan zhing zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: drug ldan zhing zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The text says “the field endowed with six.”

original: gzhi de sku lnga ngo bo nyid kyi sku dang drug tu ldan /
analyzed: gzhi de sku lnga ngo bo nyid kyi sku dang drug tu ldan /
translated: That basis is endowed with six: the five kāyas and the svabhāvakāya.

original: rigs lnga aa'i rigs dang drug tu ldan //
analyzed: rigs lnga aa'i rigs dang drug tu ldan //
translated: It is endowed with six: the five families and the Ā family.

original: yum lnga bdug med pa'i yum dang drug tu ldan /
analyzed: yum lnga bdug med pa'i yum dang drug tu ldan /
translated: It is endowed with six: the five mothers and the mother of the absence of smoke.

original: drug lnga khong khro dang drug tu ldan /
analyzed: drug lnga khong khro dang drug tu ldan /
translated: It is endowed with six: the five afflictions and anger.

original: rigs drug dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rigs drug dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It possesses the six classes.🔽The nondual arising

original: gnyis su med par 'byung ba dang // zhes pa de yang drug pa de rnams dngos su mtshan ma dad bcas par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis su med par 'byung ba dang // zhes pa de yang drug pa de rnams dngos su mtshan ma dad bcas par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: also is not actually present as the sign of those six,

original: yon tan gyi char yod ces bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan gyi char yod ces bya'o //
translated: but it is said to exist as a quality.

original: dngos su med pas skyon du mi 'gyur yon tan gyi char yod pas phyir snang nus te /
analyzed: dngos su med pas skyon du mi 'gyur yon tan gyi char yod pas phyir snang nus te /
translated: Since it is not actually present, it does not become a fault; since it exists as a quality, it is able to appear.

original: mi skye chos can zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: mi skye chos can zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It is said to be “a phenomenon that does not arise.”

original: rang 'byung gnyis med la yon tan 'gag med du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rang 'byung gnyis med la yon tan 'gag med du gnas pa'o //
translated: The two kinds of self-originated nonduality exist as unceasing qualities.

original: de yang ji ltar gnas na chos nyid chos sku dbyer med pa'i ngang na rig pa'i rang gdangs 'byung pa lnga'i bum pa na shes rab rig pa'i sku lnga sa bon du smin la /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar gnas na chos nyid chos sku dbyer med pa'i ngang na rig pa'i rang gdangs 'byung pa lnga'i bum pa na shes rab rig pa'i sku lnga sa bon du smin la /
translated: If it is asked how those exist, the intrinsic luminescence of vidya exists in the state of the inseparable dharmata dharmakaya. The five kayas of the vidya of wisdom ripen as seeds in the vase of the five elements.

original: 'bras bur ma smin te /
analyzed: 'bras bur ma smin te /
translated: They do not ripen as a result.

original: stong pa ye shes kyi snying po can du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa ye shes kyi snying po can du gnas pa'o //
translated: They exist as the essence of the wisdom of emptiness.

original: 'di gsungs pa zhe na /
analyzed: 'di gsungs pa zhe na /
translated: If it is asked what is that,

original: de mtshon pa'i thabs sngags kyi sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: de mtshon pa'i thabs sngags kyi sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: the method of illustrating it is the mantra sound just as it is.

original: aa zhes pa dag pa skyon med de chos nyid yangs pa chen po'o //
analyzed: aa zhes pa dag pa skyon med de chos nyid yangs pa chen po'o //
translated: Ah is pure and without faults, the great spaciousness of dharmata.

original: a'a zhes pa chos nyid de'i klong na chos sku ye nas gnas te /
analyzed: a'a zhes pa chos nyid de'i klong na chos sku ye nas gnas te /
translated: A is the dharmakaya that has always existed within the dimension of that dharmata.

original: rgyun gyis rtag pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun gyis rtag pa'o //
translated: It is permanent because it is continuous.

original: ai zhes pa thugs rje chen po can /🔽a'i zhes pa thugs rje rgyun gyis rtag pa'o //
analyzed: ai zhes pa thugs rje chen po can / a'i zhes pa thugs rje rgyun gyis rtag pa'o //
translated: I is the one who possesses great compassion.🔽Ai is the compassion that is permanent because it is continuous.

original: au a'u zhes pa thugs rjes dang po'i rang sar gnyis su med par bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: au a'u zhes pa thugs rjes dang po'i rang sar gnyis su med par bsdus pa'o //
translated: O and AU are the nonduality of compassion and the original place of the bindu.

original: ae aee zhes pa mkhyen pa'i ye shes stobs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ae aee zhes pa mkhyen pa'i ye shes stobs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: E and ai are the powerful wisdom of omniscience.

original: ao aoo zhes pa ngo bo skye med mi rtog kyang rtsal dpyod kyi ye shes mi 'gag par phyis 'char nus pa'o //
analyzed: ao aoo zhes pa ngo bo skye med mi rtog kyang rtsal dpyod kyi ye shes mi 'gag par phyis 'char nus pa'o //
translated: O and au are the nonconceptual, unborn essence that is capable of arising later as the unobstructed wisdom of analysis.

original: aam aa:zhes pa gzhi'i yon tan de ltar snang yang don skye med dag pa mnyam nyid du gnas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: aam aa:zhes pa gzhi'i yon tan de ltar snang yang don skye med dag pa mnyam nyid du gnas zhes pa'o //
translated: Am and ah are the qualities of the basis that appear in that way, but in actuality they abide in the unborn, pure, and uniform state.

original: sthi to zhes pa rig pa 'gyur ba med pa la thugs rje thogs pa med pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sthi to zhes pa rig pa 'gyur ba med pa la thugs rje thogs pa med pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: Sthita is the unimpeded compassion that arises from unchanging vidya.

original: hri di zhes pa thugs rang 'byung gi ye shes mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: hri di zhes pa thugs rang 'byung gi ye shes mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Śrī” is the unchanging mind of self-originated gnosis.

original: dzny'a na m'u rti zhes pa thun mong gi ye shes mnyam pa'i thugs rje dang bcas pa mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dzny'a na m'u rti zhes pa thun mong gi ye shes mnyam pa'i thugs rje dang bcas pa mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Jñānamūrti” is the unchanging mind of the common gnosis endowed with uniform compassion.

original: ra ham zhes pa thugs rje 'gag med kun la snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: ra ham zhes pa thugs rje 'gag med kun la snyoms pa'o //
translated: “Rahma” is the unobstructed compassion that is equal to all.

original: de bzhin du sgra'i don khong nas brda'o //🔽buddho buddh'a n'an dya dhva barti nam aom badzra t'i kshna /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra'i don khong nas brda'o // buddho buddh'a n'an dya dhva barti nam aom badzra t'i kshna /
translated: Likewise, the meaning of the sounds is the inner symbolic meaning.🔽“Budho buddhānāṃ dhyāva-vartināṃ oṃ vajra-tīkṣṇa”

original: du:kha tstshe da pra dzny'a dzny'a na m'u rta ye dzny'a na @42b k'a ya b'a g'i shva ra /
analyzed: du:kha tstshe da pra dzny'a dzny'a na m'u rta ye dzny'a na @42b k'a ya b'a g'i shva ra /
translated: “duḥkha-ccheda-prajñā-jñānamūrtaye jñāna-kāya-vāgīśvara”

original: aa ra pa tsa na te na ma:/
analyzed: aa ra pa tsa na te na ma:/
translated: “arhaṃ-tathāgata-naya-mantraḥ”

original: 'di ltar zhes pa gzhi'i yon tan las sku dang ye shes byung lugs ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes pa gzhi'i yon tan las sku dang ye shes byung lugs ston pa'o //
translated: “evam” indicates the way the kāyas and gnoses arise from the qualities of the basis.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes pa rig pa'i ye shes rtog pa'i mtha' dang bral zhing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes pa rig pa'i ye shes rtog pa'i mtha' dang bral zhing /
translated: “Buddha bhagavat” is the gnosis of vidyā free from the extremes of conceptuality.

original: yon tan gyi snang ba phyogs med du 'byung ste /
analyzed: yon tan gyi snang ba phyogs med du 'byung ste /
translated: The appearances of qualities arise without partiality.

original: rang gi ngo bo skyon gyi mtha' las grol ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo skyon gyi mtha' las grol ba'o //
translated: The essence is free from the extreme of faults.

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas aa las byung //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas aa las byung //
translated: The perfect Buddha arises from A.

original: zhes pa gzhi skye ba med pa rang bzhin 'gag pa med pa las yon tan gyi snang ba ye shes su 'char te /
analyzed: zhes pa gzhi skye ba med pa rang bzhin 'gag pa med pa las yon tan gyi snang ba ye shes su 'char te /
translated: From the ground of being, which is unborn and essentially unceasing, the appearances of qualities arise as wisdom.

original: rig pa shes rab kyi sku lnga rin po che 'od 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: rig pa shes rab kyi sku lnga rin po che 'od 'bar ba'o //
translated: Awareness is the five kāyas of wisdom, blazing jewels.

original: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / ces pa /
analyzed: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / ces pa /
translated: A is the supreme of all syllables.

original: dper na aa ni yig 'bru thams cad kyi ngo bo yin pa dang 'dra bar rig pa ye shes lnga dang 'byung ba las mchog tu 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dper na aa ni yig 'bru thams cad kyi ngo bo yin pa dang 'dra bar rig pa ye shes lnga dang 'byung ba las mchog tu 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Just as A is the essence of all syllables, awareness is supreme among the five wisdoms and the elements.

original: don chen yi ge dam pa yin //
analyzed: don chen yi ge dam pa yin //
translated: It is the sacred syllable of great meaning.

original: zhes pa / yi ge aa lta bu'am de la brten pa'i tshig dang ming lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa / yi ge aa lta bu'am de la brten pa'i tshig dang ming lta bu ma yin te /
translated: It is not like a syllable such as A or a word or name based on it.

original: rig pa chos kyi sku rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: rig pa chos kyi sku rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa /
translated: Awareness is the dharmakāya, pure by nature.

original: rang 'byung dbyer med kyi don zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rang 'byung dbyer med kyi don zhes pa'o //
translated: It is called “the meaning of the indivisible self-originated.”

original: dper na yi ge aa khong nas 'byung ste sgra gzhan gyi gnas lta bu yin pas sgra rang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dper na yi ge aa khong nas 'byung ste sgra gzhan gyi gnas lta bu yin pas sgra rang 'byung ngo //
translated: For example, the syllable A arises from within and is the basis for other sounds; therefore, sound is self-originated.

original: rang byung yin pas skye ba med do //
analyzed: rang byung yin pas skye ba med do //
translated: Since it is self-originated, it is unborn.

original: de bzhin du 'khor 'das kyi chos ni gzhi las 'byung la /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khor 'das kyi chos ni gzhi las 'byung la /
translated: In the same way, the phenomena of samsara and nirvana arise from the ground.

original: gzhi de la rgyu rkyen med par rang 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gzhi de la rgyu rkyen med par rang 'byung ba'o //
translated: That ground is self-arisen without causes and conditions.

original: de bas skye ba med do //
analyzed: de bas skye ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no arising.

original: tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste //
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste //
translated: It is free from verbal expression.

original: zhes pa rig pa brjod pa las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa rig pa brjod pa las 'das pa'o //
translated: This is the expression of awareness that is beyond words.🔽It is the supreme cause of all expressions.

original: brjod pa kun gyi rgyu yi mchog / ces pa de'i yon tan nam rtsal du sgra dang tha snyad thams cad shar ba'o //
analyzed: brjod pa kun gyi rgyu yi mchog / ces pa de'i yon tan nam rtsal du sgra dang tha snyad thams cad shar ba'o //
translated: This is the quality or potential of that [awareness], from which all sounds and conventions arise.

original: thams cad kyi gzhi rtsa yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi gzhi rtsa yin zhes pa'o //
translated: It is the ground and root of everything.

original: tshig kun rab tu gsal bar byed //
analyzed: tshig kun rab tu gsal bar byed //
translated: It illuminates all words.

original: ces pa mtshon bya don gyi gzhi mo de /
analyzed: ces pa mtshon bya don gyi gzhi mo de /
translated: This is the ground of the meaning that is to be illustrated.

original: mtshon byed tshig gi sgron ma la brten nas mtshon cing brjod pas na tshig gsal bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: mtshon byed tshig gi sgron ma la brten nas mtshon cing brjod pas na tshig gsal bar ston pa'o //
translated: Since it is illustrated and expressed in dependence on the lamp of the words that illustrate it, the words clearly reveal it.

original: mchod pa chen po 'dod chags che //
analyzed: mchod pa chen po 'dod chags che //
translated: The great offering is great desire.

original: zhes pa 'di ni ye shes kyi mtshan nyid ston te /
analyzed: zhes pa 'di ni ye shes kyi mtshan nyid ston te /
translated: This teaches the characteristic of pristine consciousness.

original: sems can gyi 'dod chags rang rgyud las log ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi 'dod chags rang rgyud las log ste /
translated: Sentient beings' desire is reversed in their continuums.

original: de'i gnyen por rig pa'i shes rab dpyod byed ma 'gags pas so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por rig pa'i shes rab dpyod byed ma 'gags pas so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The antidote to that is the wisdom of awareness, which is the wisdom of discernment because it is unimpeded and analytical.

original: sems can thams cad dga' bar byed //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dga' bar byed //
translated: It delights all sentient beings.

original: ces pa thugs rje chen pos rtsol ba bya mi dgos par 'dod chags ye shes su bstan pas gnyis su med de dga' ba'o //
analyzed: ces pa thugs rje chen pos rtsol ba bya mi dgos par 'dod chags ye shes su bstan pas gnyis su med de dga' ba'o //
translated: Since desire is explained as pristine consciousness, it is nondual with great compassion, which is delight because it does not need to be generated.

original: mchod pa chen po zhe sdang che //
analyzed: mchod pa chen po zhe sdang che //
translated: Great offering is great anger.

original: zhes pa 'gro ba'i nyon mongs pa sel te /🔽rig pa @43a * //
analyzed: zhes pa 'gro ba'i nyon mongs pa sel te / rig pa @43a * //
translated: Since the afflictions of migrating beings are removed,🔽awareness is unimpeded.

original: 'gag pa med de me long ye shes so //
analyzed: 'gag pa med de me long ye shes so //
translated: That is the mirror-like pristine consciousness.

original: nyon mongs kun gyi dgra che ba //
analyzed: nyon mongs kun gyi dgra che ba //
translated: It is the great enemy of all afflictions.

original: zhes pa nyon mongs pa mi gnas te ye shes ma 'gags pa yin pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa nyon mongs pa mi gnas te ye shes ma 'gags pa yin pas so //
translated: Since the afflictions do not abide, pristine consciousness is unimpeded.

original: mchod pa chen po gti mug che //
analyzed: mchod pa chen po gti mug che //
translated: Great offering is great stupidity.

original: zhes pa rig pa 'byed pa med pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: zhes pa rig pa 'byed pa med pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: The wisdom that does not differentiate awareness

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
translated: is the pristine consciousness of the dharmadhatu.

original: gti mug blo ste zhes pa /
analyzed: gti mug blo ste zhes pa /
translated: Stupidity is the mind.

original: mi rtog pa'i shes rab gcod pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtog pa'i shes rab gcod pa'o //
translated: Nonconceptual wisdom is the cutter.

original: gti mug sel zhes pa mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug sel zhes pa mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Since stupidity is removed, it does not abide.

original: mchod pa chen po khro ba che //
analyzed: mchod pa chen po khro ba che //
translated: Great offering is great wrath.

original: zhes pa gnyis 'dzin dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa mi gnas te /
analyzed: zhes pa gnyis 'dzin dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa mi gnas te /
translated: The two lines beginning “The afflictions that are dualistic mind” mean that the afflictions that are dualistic mind do not abide.

original: rang 'byung gi ye shes 'od du gsal ba'o //🔽khro ba chen po dgra che ba //
analyzed: rang 'byung gi ye shes 'od du gsal ba'o // khro ba chen po dgra che ba //
translated: Self-originated gnosis manifests as light.

original: zhes pa ma rig pa'i khong khro 'joms pa'o //🔽mchod pa chen po chags pa che //
analyzed: zhes pa ma rig pa'i khong khro 'joms pa'o // mchod pa chen po chags pa che //
translated: “Great wrath is the great enemy” means that the wrath of ignorance is destroyed.

original: zhes pa zag pa med pa'i bde ba'o //🔽chags pa thams cad sel bar byed //
analyzed: zhes pa zag pa med pa'i bde ba'o // chags pa thams cad sel bar byed //
translated: “Great offering is great desire” means that there is undissipating bliss.

original: ces pa rtog bcas so //🔽'dod pa chen po bde ba che //
analyzed: ces pa rtog bcas so // 'dod pa chen po bde ba che //
translated: “All desires are removed” means that there is conceptualization.

original: zhes pa rang gis rang gi sku dang ye shes rtogs par 'dod pa de rtogs pas bya ba rtsal las grol ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa rang gis rang gi sku dang ye shes rtogs par 'dod pa de rtogs pas bya ba rtsal las grol ba'o //
translated: “Great desire is great bliss” means that the desire to realize one’s own body and gnosis is realized.

original: yang na chags pa med pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: yang na chags pa med pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: Alternatively, “desire” is nonattached bliss.

original: gnyis med kyi don la dgyes shing nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis med kyi don la dgyes shing nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: “Delight” is delight in the meaning of nonduality.

original: gzugs chen zhes pa ye shes kyi spyan lngas kun du khyab gdal ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs chen zhes pa ye shes kyi spyan lngas kun du khyab gdal ba'o //
translated: “Great form” is the pervasiveness of the five eyes of gnosis.

original: lus kyang che ba ste zhes pa rin po che'i lus nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: lus kyang che ba ste zhes pa rin po che'i lus nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: “The body is also great” means that the precious body is like space.

original: kha dog che zhing zhes pa gzugs yin te /
analyzed: kha dog che zhing zhes pa gzugs yin te /
translated: Great color is form.

original: de nyid kha dog rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kha dog rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'o //
translated: That itself has five aspects of color.

original: lus bong che ba ni gzugs kyi rten nas rin po che'i dbugs so //
analyzed: lus bong che ba ni gzugs kyi rten nas rin po che'i dbugs so //
translated: Great body is the support of form, the jeweled breath.

original: che ba ni lus dang gzugs can las grol ba'o //
analyzed: che ba ni lus dang gzugs can las grol ba'o //
translated: Great is liberated from body and form.

original: ming yang che zhing zhes pa de'i mtshan no //
analyzed: ming yang che zhing zhes pa de'i mtshan no //
translated: Name is its name.

original: rgya che zhes pa 'dogs shing brjod pa'i lugs mang ba'o //
analyzed: rgya che zhes pa 'dogs shing brjod pa'i lugs mang ba'o //
translated: Great extent is the many ways of designation and expression.

original: dkyil 'khor chen po yangs pa yin //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po yangs pa yin //
translated: It is the great, vast maṇḍala.

original: zhes pa rig pa'i ye shes dbyings rnam par dag pa'i ngang nas 'gag pa med par dang gis gnas so //
analyzed: zhes pa rig pa'i ye shes dbyings rnam par dag pa'i ngang nas 'gag pa med par dang gis gnas so //

original: bde ba rnyed pas 'jigs med thob //
analyzed: bde ba rnyed pas 'jigs med thob //
translated: Having attained bliss, one obtains fearlessness.

original: ces pa chos sku bya brtsal las 'das pa rang chas su rtogs pas 'khor ba la nyam ming ba'o //
analyzed: ces pa chos sku bya brtsal las 'das pa rang chas su rtogs pas 'khor ba la nyam ming ba'o //
translated: Since the dharmakāya is realized as a natural attribute beyond activity and effort, one is not intimidated by samsāra.

original: bsil bar gyur pas rnyog pa med //
analyzed: bsil bar gyur pas rnyog pa med //
translated: Since it is cool, it is free of turbidity.

original: ces pa sku gsum rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa sku gsum rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: This is the purity of the three kāyas.

original: rig pa dang ni rkang par ldan //
analyzed: rig pa dang ni rkang par ldan //
translated: Endowed with knowledge and feet

original: zhes pa rang snang rtogs shing thabs ma 'gags pas skad cig ma la grol nus pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa rang snang rtogs shing thabs ma 'gags pas skad cig ma la grol nus pa'o //
translated: Since one’s appearances are realized and the method is unimpeded, one is able to be liberated in a moment.🔽The sugata is the supreme knower of the world

original: bde gshegs 'jig rten rig pa'i mchog / ces pa lus bar pa nas chos kyi spyan nam mkha' las nyi ma shar ba lta bur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bde gshegs 'jig rten rig pa'i mchog / ces pa lus bar pa nas chos kyi spyan nam mkha' las nyi ma shar ba lta bur gyur pa'o //
translated: Since the dharmakāya arises from the middle nāḍī, the eye of dharma is like the sun rising in the sky.

original: bdag gir mi 'dzin dar mi 'dzin //
analyzed: bdag gir mi 'dzin dar mi 'dzin //
translated: Not grasping as mine, not grasping as self

original: zhes pa gong bzhin rnam pa thams cad mkhyen yang gnyis 'dzin med de dbugs can min pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa gong bzhin rnam pa thams cad mkhyen yang gnyis 'dzin med de dbugs can min pas so //
translated: As above, although one knows all aspects, one does not grasp a duality because one is not a breather.

original: bden pa gnyis kyi tshul la gnas //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis kyi tshul la gnas //
translated: Abiding in the mode of the two truths

original: zhes pa yar chos sku rin po che'i spugs bden /
analyzed: zhes pa yar chos sku rin po che'i spugs bden /
translated: The upper part is the truth of the precious dharmakāya.

original: mar sprul sku bag chags kyi spugs bden te /
analyzed: mar sprul sku bag chags kyi spugs bden te /
translated: The lower part is the truth of the traces of the nirmāṇakāya.

original: gnyis snang yod la gnyis 'dzin med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis snang yod la gnyis 'dzin med pa'o //
translated: Although dualistic appearances exist, there is no grasping a duality.

original: dngos longs sku'o //
analyzed: dngos longs sku'o //
translated: The actual is the saṃbhogakāya.

original: 'khor ba'i pha rol mthar son pa //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i pha rol mthar son pa //
translated: Having gone to the end of the far shore of saṃsāra

original: zhes pa mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Is nirvāṇa.

original: bya ba byas pa skam sar gnas //
analyzed: bya ba byas pa skam sar gnas //
translated: Having done what is to be done, one abides on dry land.

original: zhes pa lus par pa nas sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad de /
analyzed: zhes pa lus par pa nas sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad de /
translated: Having thus appeared in the world, he performs the deeds of a buddha.

original: de nas mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de nas mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Then he passes into nirvana.

original: ye shes 'ba' zhig las byung ba //
analyzed: ye shes 'ba' zhig las byung ba //
translated: Arisen from pristine wisdom alone,

original: zhes pa 'khor 'das thams cad ye shes kyi rtsal lo //
analyzed: zhes pa 'khor 'das thams cad ye shes kyi rtsal lo //
translated: all of samsara and nirvana is the energy of pristine wisdom.

original: shes rab mtshon chas rnam 'joms pa //
analyzed: shes rab mtshon chas rnam 'joms pa //
translated: The weapon of wisdom utterly destroys.

original: zhes pa shes rab can gyis de ltar rtogs pa'i dus na ;
analyzed: zhes pa shes rab can gyis de ltar rtogs pa'i dus na ;
translated: When the wise realize it in this way,

original: 'khor 'das gnyis sam gzung 'dzin gnyis mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor 'das gnyis sam gzung 'dzin gnyis mi gnas pa'o //
translated: neither samsara nor nirvana, neither subject nor object, remain.

original: dam chos chos rgyal gsal bar ldan //
analyzed: dam chos chos rgyal gsal bar ldan //
translated: The holy Dharma, the shining king of Dharma,

original: zhes pa sprul pa'i sku drug go //
analyzed: zhes pa sprul pa'i sku drug go //
translated: refers to the six emanation bodies.

original: yang na gzhi la 'khor 'das kyi tshogs gnyis yon tan du snang ba'o //
analyzed: yang na gzhi la 'khor 'das kyi tshogs gnyis yon tan du snang ba'o //
translated: Alternatively, the two accumulations of samsara and nirvana appear as qualities in the ground.🔽The supreme illuminator of the world

original: 'jig rten snang bar byed pa'i mchog / ces pa rtsal 'jig rten du snang ba'am 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba la sku dang ye shes snang bar byed pa'i mchog go //
analyzed: 'jig rten snang bar byed pa'i mchog / ces pa rtsal 'jig rten du snang ba'am 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba la sku dang ye shes snang bar byed pa'i mchog go //
translated: refers to the energy appearing in the world or the supreme illuminator of the bodies and pristine wisdoms for the beings of the world.

original: chos kyi dbang phyug chos kyi rgyal //
analyzed: chos kyi dbang phyug chos kyi rgyal //
translated: The lord of Dharma, the king of Dharma,

original: zhes pa sangs rgyas kyi sprul pas chos la dbang thob ste mnga' mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa sangs rgyas kyi sprul pas chos la dbang thob ste mnga' mdzad pa'o //
translated: This verse says that the emanations of the buddhas have power over phenomena and exercise dominion over them.

original: legs pa'i lam ni ston pa po //🔽zhes pa sprul skus 'gro ba la dbang po rab 'bring tha mal grol @47a * //
analyzed: legs pa'i lam ni ston pa po // zhes pa sprul skus 'gro ba la dbang po rab 'bring tha mal grol @47a * //
translated: The teacher of the excellent path

original: thabs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thabs bstan pa'o //
translated: This verse says that the nirmāṇakāya teaches the methods of liberation to beings, according to their higher, middling, or lower faculties.

original: don grub bsam pa grub pa ste //
analyzed: don grub bsam pa grub pa ste //
translated: The one who accomplishes the aims and fulfills the wishes

original: zhes pa sprul pa'i skus sems can gyi don grub pa ste /🔽ma nu'i sems la sogs pa shes pas bsam pa sgrub nus pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa sprul pa'i skus sems can gyi don grub pa ste / ma nu'i sems la sogs pa shes pas bsam pa sgrub nus pa'o //
translated: This verse says that the nirmāṇakāya accomplishes the aims of sentient beings.

original: kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs //
analyzed: kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs //
translated: The one who has abandoned all conceptual thoughts

original: zhes pa thugs kyi dgongs pa mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa thugs kyi dgongs pa mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: This verse says that the transcendent state of the mind is unmoving.

original: rnam par mi rtog dbyings mi zad //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog dbyings mi zad //
translated: The nonconceptual expanse that is inexhaustible

original: ces pa dbyings mi g-yo mi 'gyur bas na'o //
analyzed: ces pa dbyings mi g-yo mi 'gyur bas na'o //
translated: This verse says that the expanse is unmoving and unchanging.

original: chos dbyings dam pa zad mi shes //
analyzed: chos dbyings dam pa zad mi shes //
translated: The supreme dharmadhātu that is inexhaustible

original: zhes pa de'i nang nas yon tan 'byung ba rin po che'i sku las /
analyzed: zhes pa de'i nang nas yon tan 'byung ba rin po che'i sku las /
translated: This verse says that the qualities arise from the precious kāya within that.🔽The one who is beyond birth and cessation in all appearances and sounds

original: snang grags thams cad shar yang chos nyid la skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: snang grags thams cad shar yang chos nyid la skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'o //
translated: This verse says that although everything appears and resounds, it is beyond birth and cessation in dharmatā.🔽The one who is beyond the extremes of the four extremes🔽This verse says that the kāya is beyond the extremes of the four extremes.

original: bsod nams ldan pa bsod nams tshogs //
analyzed: bsod nams ldan pa bsod nams tshogs //
translated: The one with merit has the accumulation of merit.

original: zhes pa gzhi chos kyi sku la mkhas pa tshogs gnyis rdzogs te /🔽yon tan gyi rtsal 'byung ba lnga ye shes su gsal zhing de ltar grub pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs /
analyzed: zhes pa gzhi chos kyi sku la mkhas pa tshogs gnyis rdzogs te / yon tan gyi rtsal 'byung ba lnga ye shes su gsal zhing de ltar grub pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs /
translated: The one skilled in the basis, the dharmakāya, completes the two accumulations.🔽The arising of the potential of qualities is the clarity of the five pristine consciousnesses.

original: ye shes bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: ye shes bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: The accumulation of pristine consciousness is the accumulation of merit.

original: ye shes ye shes khyad par che //
analyzed: ye shes ye shes khyad par che //
translated: Pristine consciousness is a great distinction.

original: zhes pa zhi gnas kyi ye shes dang mtshan nyid 'dzin ba'i ye shes kyi khyad par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa zhi gnas kyi ye shes dang mtshan nyid 'dzin ba'i ye shes kyi khyad par bstan pa'o //
translated: This explains the distinction between the pristine consciousness of śamatha and the pristine consciousness that apprehends characteristics.

original: de yang zhi gnas las mtshan nyid 'dzin par shar la /
analyzed: de yang zhi gnas las mtshan nyid 'dzin par shar la /
translated: Moreover, the apprehender of characteristics arises from śamatha.

original: de las de byung ba'o //
analyzed: de las de byung ba'o //
translated: That arises from this.

original: de las de 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: de las de 'phags pa'o //
translated: This is superior to that.

original: ye shes ldan pa yod med shes //
analyzed: ye shes ldan pa yod med shes //
translated: The one with pristine consciousness knows existence and nonexistence.

original: zhes pa yon tan gyi snang ba gzhil grub tshul brtsi ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa yon tan gyi snang ba gzhil grub tshul brtsi ba'o //
translated: This is the method of measuring the dissolution of the appearances of qualities.

original: tshogs gnyis tshogs ni bsags pa po //
analyzed: tshogs gnyis tshogs ni bsags pa po //
translated: The one who accumulates the two accumulations accumulates the two accumulations.

original: zhes pa chos sku dang gzugs sku gnyis 'du 'bral med par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa chos sku dang gzugs sku gnyis 'du 'bral med par rtogs pa'o //
translated: This is the realization that the dharmakāya and the rūpakāya are inseparable.

original: rtog pa kun rgyal rnal 'byor can //
analyzed: rtog pa kun rgyal rnal 'byor can //
translated: The one with yoga, the king of all concepts,

original: zhes pa 'gyur ba med pa'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa 'gyur ba med pa'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: As such, there is the transcendent state of unchanging vidya.🔽The supreme one with the mind that contemplates

original: bsam gtan bsam bya blo ldan mchog / ces pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan bsam bya blo ldan mchog / ces pa /
translated: contemplation.

original: bsgom bya sku dang ye shes sgom byed rig pa'i rgyal po gnyis kyi 'brel so brtsis pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom bya sku dang ye shes sgom byed rig pa'i rgyal po gnyis kyi 'brel so brtsis pa'o //
translated: The object of meditation is the buddhahood of the kayas and pristine consciousnesses. The meditator is the king of vidya. The two are connected by the teeth.

original: so so rang rig mi g-yo ba //
analyzed: so so rang rig mi g-yo ba //
translated: The individual is the unchanging vidya.

original: zhes pa rig pa'i rtsal so sor rdzogs pa'i dus na /
analyzed: zhes pa rig pa'i rtsal so sor rdzogs pa'i dus na /
translated: When the potential of vidya is perfected in each individual,

original: so sor rig ste grol ba'i dus na yang rin chen spubs na dgongs pa so sor gnas pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rig ste grol ba'i dus na yang rin chen spubs na dgongs pa so sor gnas pa'o //
translated: it is individually known. When there is the time of liberation, the transcendent state abides individually in the precious potential.

original: de shes pa gnas 'gyur gyi ye shes med de /
analyzed: de shes pa gnas 'gyur gyi ye shes med de /
translated: Since there is no pristine consciousness of the transformation of the🔽knower,

original: rig pa zang thal yin pas na'o //
analyzed: rig pa zang thal yin pas na'o //
translated: there is no obstruction in vidya.

original: mchog gi dang po sku gsum 'chang //
analyzed: mchog gi dang po sku gsum 'chang //
translated: The first supreme one holds the three kayas.

original: zhes pa rin po che'i spubs la sku gsum nang na gsal lo //
analyzed: zhes pa rin po che'i spubs la sku gsum nang na gsal lo //
translated: The three kayas manifest in the precious potential.

original: sangs rgyas sku lnga'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sku lnga'i bdag nyid can //
translated: The nature of the five kayas of the buddhas

original: zhes pa chos kyi sku'i sprul sku'o //
analyzed: zhes pa chos kyi sku'i sprul sku'o //
translated: is the nirmanakaya of the dharmakaya.🔽The lord of the five pristine consciousnesses

original: khyab bdag ye shes lnga yi bdag / ces pa longs sku'i lus so //
analyzed: khyab bdag ye shes lnga yi bdag / ces pa longs sku'i lus so //
translated: is the sambhogakaya.

original: de yang yum lnga'i nang nas so //
analyzed: de yang yum lnga'i nang nas so //
translated: Further, it is from within the five mothers.

original: sangs rgyas mnga' @47b bdag cod pan can //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mnga' @47b bdag cod pan can //
translated: The Buddha has the crown of the lords.

original: zhes pa gzhi la grub ste /
analyzed: zhes pa gzhi la grub ste /
translated: This is established in the basis.

original: lha don gyi ngo bo la snang tsam na /
analyzed: lha don gyi ngo bo la snang tsam na /
translated: When the essence of the meaning of the deity merely appears,

original: he ru ka lnga dbu rgyan du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: he ru ka lnga dbu rgyan du gnas pa'o //
translated: the five herukas exist as the crown ornament.

original: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i skabs na /
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i skabs na /
translated: When taming migrating beings,

original: he ru ka'i dbu rgyan rigs lnga'o //🔽spyan lnga chags pa med pa 'chang //
analyzed: he ru ka'i dbu rgyan rigs lnga'o // spyan lnga chags pa med pa 'chang //
translated: the crown ornament of the herukas is the five families.🔽He holds the five eyes that are free from attachment.

original: zhes pa longs sku spyan lnga dang ldan te mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa longs sku spyan lnga dang ldan te mi gnas pa'o //
translated: The five eyes of the sambhogakaya are endowed with nonabiding.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa po //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa po //
translated: He is the producer of all buddhas.

original: zhes pa rig pa las rnam snang la sogs pa shar te de dag la sogs pa thams cad rig pa las 'byung zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa rig pa las rnam snang la sogs pa shar te de dag la sogs pa thams cad rig pa las 'byung zhes pa'o //
translated: Since the five families such as Vairocana arise from vidya, all of them arise from vidya.🔽He is the supreme son of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas sras po dam pa'i mchog / ces pa gzugs sku'i sangs rgyas thams cad chos sku'i sras te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras po dam pa'i mchog / ces pa gzugs sku'i sangs rgyas thams cad chos sku'i sras te /
translated: All buddhas of the rupakaya are the sons of the dharmakaya.

original: dbyer mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: dbyer mi phyed pa'o //
translated: They are inseparable.

original: de las gzhan pa mi gnas so //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa mi gnas so //
translated: There is no abiding elsewhere.

original: shes pas srid 'byung skye gnas med //
analyzed: shes pas srid 'byung skye gnas med //
translated: Since it is known, there is no birth in the origin of existence.

original: ces pa gong ma'i don rtogs pas srid pa gsum dang skye ba bzhi'i rgyu ma rig pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa gong ma'i don rtogs pas srid pa gsum dang skye ba bzhi'i rgyu ma rig pa med pa'o //
translated: Since the meaning of the above is realized, there is no ignorance, the cause of the three existences and four birthplaces.

original: chos las 'byung ba srid pa sel //
analyzed: chos las 'byung ba srid pa sel //
translated: The source of phenomena is eliminated.

original: zhes pa mtshan ma phra rags rtog pa rtsing zhib las snang ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa mtshan ma phra rags rtog pa rtsing zhib las snang ba'o //
translated: Since the cause of the three existences is eliminated, the appearances of coarse and subtle signs are eliminated.

original: srid pa rtogs pas mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa rtogs pas mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Since existence is realized, it does not abide.🔽The sole lord of the vajra of solidity

original: gcig pu sra mkhregs rdo rje'i bdag / ces pa chos las grol nas chos 'gyur ba med pa'i gdan la sku zad thal chen po'i ngang na rin po che 'od 'bar lnga'i rang bzhin rig pa'i bdag nyid chen por gnas te phyis 'gyur mi srid do //
analyzed: gcig pu sra mkhregs rdo rje'i bdag / ces pa chos las grol nas chos 'gyur ba med pa'i gdan la sku zad thal chen po'i ngang na rin po che 'od 'bar lnga'i rang bzhin rig pa'i bdag nyid chen por gnas te phyis 'gyur mi srid do //
translated: Since one is liberated from phenomena, the kāya abides in the state of great, total destruction, on the seat of the unchanging transformation of phenomena, as the nature of the great lord of vidyā, the nature of the five blazing precious lights.

original: skyes ma thag par 'gro ba'i bdag / ces pa /🔽shes rab ye shes me bo che ;
analyzed: skyes ma thag par 'gro ba'i bdag / ces pa / shes rab ye shes me bo che ;
translated: The lord who goes immediately upon birth🔽The great fire of the wisdom of wisdom

original: / zhes pa phyogs lhung med pa'i shes rab las rtsal ye shes kyi me chen po lngar gsal ba'o //
analyzed: / zhes pa phyogs lhung med pa'i shes rab las rtsal ye shes kyi me chen po lngar gsal ba'o //
translated: The great fire of the wisdom of nonabiding wisdom manifests as five.

original: skye ma thag pa'i 'gro ba 'di yin thams cad rang snang yin zhing rang shar bas slar yang grol ba'o //
analyzed: skye ma thag pa'i 'gro ba 'di yin thams cad rang snang yin zhing rang shar bas slar yang grol ba'o //
translated: All these beings who have just been born are one’s own appearances and arise by themselves, so they are liberated again.

original: nam mkha' las byung rang byung ba //
analyzed: nam mkha' las byung rang byung ba //
translated: Arisen from space, self-arisen,

original: zhes pa rig pa nam mkha' lta bu las ye shes kyi snang ba lnga chos nyid nam mkha' lta bu la shar ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa rig pa nam mkha' lta bu las ye shes kyi snang ba lnga chos nyid nam mkha' lta bu la shar ba'o //
translated: the five appearances of pristine consciousness arise in the space of dharmatā, which is like the sky, from vidyā, which is like the sky.

original: shes rab ye shes gong du bshad //
analyzed: shes rab ye shes gong du bshad //
translated: Wisdom pristine consciousness is explained above.

original: 'ong chen rnam par snang bar byed //
analyzed: 'ong chen rnam par snang bar byed //
translated: The great light illuminates.

original: ces pa ye shes kyi me de ye nas rang 'byung yin la /
analyzed: ces pa ye shes kyi me de ye nas rang 'byung yin la /
translated: That fire of pristine consciousness is self-originated from the beginning.

original: kha dog kyang mthing ga la sogs pa lngar gsal zhing de'i snang ba la rtogs ma rtogs kyis 'khor 'das su shar ba'o //
analyzed: kha dog kyang mthing ga la sogs pa lngar gsal zhing de'i snang ba la rtogs ma rtogs kyis 'khor 'das su shar ba'o //
translated: The colors are also clear as the five colors, such as blue, and so on. The appearances of that arise as samsāra and nirvāṇa through being realized or not realized.

original: ye shes snang ba lam me ba //
analyzed: ye shes snang ba lam me ba //
translated: The appearance of pristine consciousness is radiant.

original: zhes pa ye shes lnga'i snang ba ma 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ye shes lnga'i snang ba ma 'gags pa'o //
translated: The appearance of the five pristine consciousnesses is unimpeded.

original: 'gro ba'i mar me ye shes sgron //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i mar me ye shes sgron //
translated: The lamp of pristine consciousness of migrating beings.

original: zhes pa / gong ma'i ye shes kyi snang ba de /
analyzed: zhes pa / gong ma'i ye shes kyi snang ba de /
translated: The appearance of pristine consciousness above

original: 'gro ba'i rtags kyi ye shes kho na yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rtags kyi ye shes kho na yin zhes pa'o //
translated: is only the sign of pristine consciousness of migrating beings.

original: phyogs gcig ni sprul pa'i sku drug gis 'gro ba'i don byed pa la zer ro //🔽gzi @48a * //
analyzed: phyogs gcig ni sprul pa'i sku drug gis 'gro ba'i don byed pa la zer ro // gzi @48a * //
translated: One aspect is called the benefit for migrating beings by the six nirmāṇakāyas.

original: brjid chen po 'od gsal ba //
analyzed: brjid chen po 'od gsal ba //
translated: The great splendor is luminosity.

original: zhes pa rig pa'i ye shes kyis 'khor 'das zil gyis gnon cing ngo bom 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa rig pa'i ye shes kyis 'khor 'das zil gyis gnon cing ngo bom 'gags pa'o //
translated: Since the pristine consciousness of vidyā overwhelms samsāra and nirvāṇa, the essence is unceasing.

original: sngags mchog mnga' bdag rig sngags rgyal //
analyzed: sngags mchog mnga' bdag rig sngags rgyal //
translated: The lord of the supreme mantra is the king of vidyā mantras.

original: zhes pa sngags kyi nang nas kyang gzhan las lhag pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa sngags kyi nang nas kyang gzhan las lhag pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is superior to others among the mantras.

original: rang gi snang ba ma 'gags cir yang snang bas /
analyzed: rang gi snang ba ma 'gags cir yang snang bas /
translated: Since one’s own appearances are unceasing and appear as anything at all,

original: rig pa ni thams cad kyi bdag po ste mnga' mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa ni thams cad kyi bdag po ste mnga' mdzad pa'o //
translated: vidyā is the lord of all and is the one who wields power.

original: gsang sngags rgyal po don chen byed //
analyzed: gsang sngags rgyal po don chen byed //
translated: The king of secret mantras performs the great benefit.

original: ces pa rig pa'i ye shes de yon tan gyi snang ba ma 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa rig pa'i ye shes de yon tan gyi snang ba ma 'gags pa'o //
translated: The meaning of that pristine consciousness of vidyā is the unceasing appearance of qualities.

original: gtsug tor chen po rmad byung gtsug //
analyzed: gtsug tor chen po rmad byung gtsug //

analyzed: @51a * // thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mtsho //

analyzed: ma rig sgo nga'i spubs 'byed pa //

analyzed: zhes pa sems dang ye shes 'byed thabs dang ngo sprod thabs so //

analyzed: ye shes dbang bskur cod pan can //

analyzed: 'gro drug gi lus ngag yid gsum gyi sgrib pa bsal te /

analyzed: mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi lus las grol te /

analyzed: de yang blo rab 'bring gis grol nas sku dang ye shes mngon du gyur pa'o //

analyzed: de'i dus su sgrib pa kun las des par grol te nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa dang gis dag pa'o //
